channel.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
channel.description:
Hello. I need some help getting my printer shared from ubuntu computer to my, mom and dads windows computers. First, I have read this guide I think look promising.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NetworkPrintingFromWinXP
But, there are some parts I didn't understand. I need some help pretty fast. I would like to know exactly how to do it and what I need to do.
Help will be greatly appreciated.
Thanks -Kneistol

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

okay. here is what i have done so far. I have fixed all that things with the ubuntu computer. Everything. the noetwork printer works fine for ubuntu. It connects to the smb:// thingy and print out. Now i need the windows side.
How to make my computer find the samba server?
And what should i do when it finds the samba server+

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Well your first step is getting windows to see your samba server, obviously nothing will work without that.

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

i used the \10.0.0.3\iP4000 as the url… still did not work… It did not find the server or the printer

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Type in the URL manually, try using the IP of the Linux computer instead of the name. Also the windows computer needs to be in the same workgroup, which looks like ‘workgroup’, so I’d say, from windows, the printer URL would be:

\192.168.1.3\iP4000

Substitute your own IP

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

I can print the test page on the computer I have set up the network printer. But when i search for a network printer in windows it can’t seem to find the network printer.
I am using xp and gets two choices. The one you search automaticly. And another one where you type in the URL of the printer. I have tried both but none seem to work

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Why doesn’t it ‘just work’?

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

Ok. Now I am this far i can test print from my own computer with linux… Any Ideas on how to get it printing from windows?

In Linux now I have two printers

The usb://Canon/iP4000
And smb://WORKGROUP/KESO/iP4000

Both work printing from my linux computer… Please help me get the smb printer over to windows

-kneistol

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Samba/PrinterSharing

The only alteration you’ll have to make is that where it says go to your system menu, if you are using the default 11.04 shell you’ll have to hit windows key and type a few letters of “printing” and then click the Printing icon.

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

Sorry for lack in details. I have a printer named canon pixma ip4000.
I have recently installed ubuntu 11.04 deleting all the files and apps from
10.10. Now i want to share the printer to windows computers.
I don’t know if I’m using Gutsy. It’s a fresh install with no hardware.
Please help me getting this done. I need the printer shared with one neighbour
And mom and dad. If i get this done within a few weeks I will get very happy.
Im on vacation right now. I am going home next saturday. Please answer but
I won’t be able to do anything about it now.

Greetings kneistol

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I think you just need CUPS and Samba.

You aren’t running Gutsy are you? In that case, aren’t those instructions you linked to simple point and click instructions?

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a printer over wifi
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Buy a network printer.

Or http://www.pcworld.com/businesscenter/article/142985/how_to_share_a_printer_over_a_network.html

Read full topic
